data.author: CocoaBob

changelog.release_notes:
- Fixed a crash for Pebble Time series.
- Improved text scrolling for Pebble Time Round.
- Adjusted time text for 12h format for Pebble Time Round.
- Some other improvements.

New features for Pebble Time series only:
- Display SNCF announcements by long selecting the 1st row of the Next Trains list.
- Indicate SNCF announcement in the 1st row of the Next Trains list.
- Indicate delay/cancelled status in the mini timetable.

- The max number of next trains is limited to 6 to avoid consuming too much memory for the Original Pebble and Pebble Steel.
- Display time (16:34) instead of 99min (or -99min) if the time difference is greater than 99 minutes.
- Fixed a bug of display while updating Next Trains list by shaking.
- This will be the last version for the Original Pebble and Pebble Steel running OS 2.x.

data.description:
Paris Transilien is an unofficial app for checking SNCF Transilien™ trains on your wrist. Transilien™ is the brand name of the suburban railway service of the SNCF-owned railway network operating within the Île-de-France.

Main features:
1. This app lets you search Transilien train timetables.
2. Information includs departure / pass time, destinations, "Delayed / Canceled" status, stops, and the time of each stop.
3. Search a station name by choosing letters directly on your wrist. For example, you can find Saint-Lazare by only searching "AZA".
4. Long select the search result to add a destination.
5. You can reverse the direction in case you want a return trip.
6. By selecting a train, you can check its schedules and stops.
7. Add your daily itineraries into favorites.
8. Long select a favorite to edit or reorder.
9. The connection indicator in the status bar lets you know if it's ready to load timetables.
10. A soft vibration tells you the loading is finished and successful. 
11. "Low Memory" warning with a triple vibration let you know there's not enough memory to open a new window.

If you have any questions / requests / suggestions, please contact me by mail, or leave an issue in the GitHub project page. If you'd like to participate in the project, welcome to fork the repository on GitHub. Thanks!
